title: How can i collect on a judgment from someone who claims they have no money but transfers thousands out of their corporate
question: account to live on?
answers: Have you thought about taking the debtor's stock in the corporation? If you get control of some stock, you may end any S-Election previously made, and you would get inspection rights of the corporation books. If you get over 50% you may gain control of some parts of the corporation. To get the corporate assets directly, you would have to show the corporation is a sham corporation to a judge.
Counsel above me offers great suggestions

Here is a link to the LA Superior Court's self-help section that discusses collection on judgements. If the debtor is being evasive, and you've been unable to garnish wages or levy bank accounts, you can have the court order the debtor to appear in court to be subjected to a debtor's examination. The debtor will have to answer questions about their income, businesses, and assets that might be subject to your judgment.

Collecting on a judgment can be complicated and difficult, especially when the debtor operates a business and is uncooperative. You should meet with a debt collection attorney in your area right away. They will have dealt with challenging debtors and will know ways to find assets and other resources that the debtor may be attempting to hide.
Garnish his wages at the corporation.
